flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

lines.text: Use your O’Reilly Media Google Docs account and login.
lines.text_raw: Use your [https://www.google.com/a/oreilly.com/ServiceLogin?service=CPanel&passive=1209600&cpbps=1&continue=https://www.google.com/a/cpanel/oreilly.com/Dashboard&followup=https://www.google.com/a/cpanel/oreilly.com/Dashboard|O’Reilly Media Google Docs account] and login.

lines.text: Click on "Docs" and find the MAKE Labs: Project Whiteboard spreed sheet. Once you login successfully you might want to Bookmark the page.
lines.text_raw: Click on "Docs" and find the MAKE Labs: Project Whiteboard spreed sheet. Once you login successfully you might want to Bookmark the page.

lines.text: Note: If this is your first time opening the spreed sheet, a senior intern may need to add you to the list of “editors” before you can alter the document.
lines.text_raw: Note: If this is your first time opening the spreed sheet, a senior intern may need to add you to the list of “editors” before you can alter the document.

lines.text: If you do not know your O’Reilly Media Google docs account info, try your Zimbra email username and password first. If that fails, contact the Intern Coordinator for help.  (Ideally all new employees should use their company Gmail accounts, and avoid using personal Gmail whenever possible.)
lines.text_raw: If you do not know your O’Reilly Media Google docs account info, try your Zimbra email username and password first. If that fails, contact the Intern Coordinator for help.  (Ideally all new employees should use their company Gmail accounts, and avoid using personal Gmail whenever possible.)

lines.text: Once open, the general layout should look similar to this.
lines.text_raw: Once open, the general layout should look similar to this.

lines.text: Each Magazine volume will be designated by a different color scheme, with the most current volume at the top of the list and other Lab duties and responsibilities at the bottom. (don’t forget to scroll to the bottom every now and then to see your other tasks!)
lines.text_raw: Each Magazine volume will be designated by a different color scheme, with the most current volume at the top of the list and other Lab duties and responsibilities at the bottom. (don’t forget to scroll to the bottom every now and then to see your other tasks!)

lines.text: In this example, all SIP projects are in yellow, all MAKE 31 projects are green, and all MAKE 32 projects are blue.
lines.text_raw: In this example, all SIP projects are in yellow, all MAKE 31 projects are green, and all MAKE 32 projects are blue.

lines.text: The titles at the top of the page in Row 1 describe what goes where. The spreed sheet extends off the screen so you will need to scroll over to the right to see all the information.
lines.text_raw: The titles at the top of the page in Row 1 describe what goes where. The spreed sheet extends off the screen so you will need to scroll over to the right to see all the information.

lines.text: There are several ways to go about changing the value in a given cell.
lines.text_raw: There are several ways to go about changing the value in a given cell.

lines.text: Drop Down list- if you see an arrow in the top right of a cell, this indicates a that you need to use the drop down menu and pick from the list of available options.
lines.text_raw: '''Drop Down list'''- if you see an arrow in the top right of a cell, this indicates a that you need to use the drop down menu and pick from the list of available options.

lines.text: Data Validation: the column INTERNS, for example, uses data validation to ensure that only the names of the current interns can be listed in the cell. The spreed sheet cross references any data that you type into these cells, and compares them to a list of names on the INFORMATION sheet. If the name entered in the cell does not Exactly match one of the names listed then the spreed sheet will not accept that name as a valid entry and will erase whatever you typed. This is done to ensure that the automated emailing feature works properly.

lines.text: Blank cells: some cells are left open for notes and comments, just click on the cell and start typing.
lines.text_raw: '''Blank cells:''' some cells are left open for notes and comments, just click on the cell and start typing.

lines.text: When an editor has a project that needs to be built for the magazine, they will fill out the Make Labs Project Request form. This form will automatically populate the last row in the spreed sheet with the new information and trigger and automated email to the Intern Coordinator to let them know that a new project has been added to the Whiteboard.
lines.text_raw: When an editor has a project that needs to be built for the magazine, they will fill out the Make Labs Project Request form. This form will automatically populate the last row in the spreed sheet with the new information and trigger and automated email to the Intern Coordinator to let them know that a new project has been added to the Whiteboard.

lines.text: After receiving the details of the new project, the Intern Coordinator will color code the project and assign the appropriate due dates before finally assigning to an intern for test/building. Once an intern has been assigned to the build, they will get a lovely automated email to their Zimbra email account with the project name, date that the project must be built by, and final dead line for all testing/building to be completed by.

Once an intern has been assigned to the build, they will get a lovely automated email to their Zimbra email account with the project name, date that the project must be built by, and final dead line for all testing/building to be completed by.

lines.text: Project Built date: at the very least, the project should be completely built by this date. If you are assigned to build multiple versions of the same project, then you need to ensure that one fully working project has been completely built. If you need step shots, use your second build to take step shots once you have worked out all the kinks from the first build. This can be done at a later date as per the photo departments schedule.
lines.text_raw: '''Project Built date:''' at the very least, the project should be completely built by this date. If you are assigned to build multiple versions of the same project, then you need to ensure that one fully working project has been completely built. If you need step shots, use your second build to take step shots once you have worked out all the kinks from the first build. This can be done at a later date as per the photo departments schedule.

lines.text: Test/Review Completed: all testing of the project should be completed by this date. The project should work as advertised in the manuscript, or you should have problem solved any issues by this time and fixed any problems. This is the deadline for all testing and reviewing of the project and all notes and questions should be filled out in the Project Build Report so that your editor can have access to the information.
lines.text_raw: '''Test/Review Completed:''' all testing of the project should be completed by this date. The project should work as advertised in the manuscript, or you should have problem solved any issues by this time and fixed any problems. This is the deadline for all testing and reviewing of the project and all notes and questions should be filled out in the Project Build Report so that your editor can have access to the information.

lines.text: Project Build Report: copy and paste the link to your Project Build Report. See next step for details.
lines.text_raw: '''Project Build Report:''' copy and paste the link to your Project Build Report. See next step for details.

lines.text: When you are first assigned to a project, your very first task is to generate a Project Build Report and start keeping track of your progress as you work. Use the Project Build Report Template and generate a copy of this document for each project that you are assigned to work on. (Follow the instructions at the top of the page listed in red)
lines.text_raw: When you are first assigned to a project, your very first task is to generate a [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-m-Cu2Cybs04rn6V9rkOyOIahp79ebVDXu8KFP2Bv1s/edit|Project Build Report] and start keeping track of your progress as you work. Use the Project Build Report Template and generate a copy of this document for each project that you are assigned to work on. (Follow the instructions at the top of the page listed in red)

lines.text: Once you generate the new Project Build Report, you will need to post a link to this document on the Whiteboard. This gives everyone who has access to the Whiteboard the ability to read over your notes and track your progress of the build. In this way, editors can quickly and easily find your notes to follow the progress of the build, or in a pinch other interns can easily read over the report and pick up where you left off if you need to suddenly hand off the project to someone else.
lines.text_raw: Once you generate the new Project Build Report, you will need to post a link to this document on the Whiteboard. This gives everyone who has access to the Whiteboard the ability to read over your notes and track your progress of the build. In this way, editors can quickly and easily find your notes to follow the progress of the build, or in a pinch other interns can easily read over the report and pick up where you left off if you need to suddenly hand off the project to someone else.

lines.text: Be sure to change the sharing permission to “anyone with the link” so that everyone who has access to the Whiteboard can click on the link and read over the document.
lines.text_raw: Be sure to change the sharing permission to “anyone with the link” so that everyone who has access to the Whiteboard can click on the link and read over the document.

lines.text: The Project Status column should be updated regularly to reflect the current stage of the project. Once the project has been assigned to an intern, it is their responsibility to update this information, this includes the final "Completed" status.
lines.text_raw: The Project Status column should be updated regularly to reflect the current stage of the project. Once the project has been assigned to an intern, it is their responsibility to update this information, this includes the final "Completed" status.

lines.text: IF a project is moved to a new magazine volume, or is canceled altogether then the editor or intern coordinator will update the Project Status and an automated email will be sent to the assigned intern.
lines.text_raw: '''IF''' a project is moved to a new magazine volume, or is canceled altogether then the editor or intern coordinator will update the Project Status and an automated email will be sent to the assigned intern.

lines.text: Ordering Parts: indicates that the intern has read over the manuscript and has placed an order or is in the process of purchasing materials for the build.
lines.text_raw: '''Ordering Parts:''' indicates that the intern has read over the manuscript and has placed an order or is in the process of purchasing materials for the build.

lines.text: Building/ Testing: indicates most, if not all parts are accounted for in the lab and that the intern has begun the building and testing phase.
lines.text_raw: '''Building/ Testing:''' indicates most, if not all parts are accounted for in the lab and that the intern has begun the building and testing phase.

lines.text: Completed: indicates all building/testing has been sucessfully completed and that the Project Build Report has been completely filled out and that the editor has been informed that the testing is done.
lines.text_raw: '''Completed:''' indicates all building/testing has been sucessfully completed and that the Project Build Report has been completely filled out and that the editor has been informed that the testing is done.

lines.text: Note: If you are waiting to build you seconder version of the same project, or need to finish taking step shots with the photo department but the building/testing phase is complete, change the status to "Complete". The main priority is that the project works as advertised, and that we have a fully working project in the Lab that has been tested.
lines.text_raw: Note: If you are waiting to build you seconder version of the same project, or need to finish taking step shots with the photo department but the building/testing phase is complete, change the status to "Complete". The main priority is that the project works as advertised, and that we have a fully working project in the Lab that has been tested.

lines.text: Please help keep this document updated, and if you have any questions or concerns about any part of this tutorial please contact the intern coordinator.
